result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashell C Schmude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lashell C Schmude is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lashell C Schmude was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lashell C Schmude was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lashell C Schmude was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring for only count 2 & 3, if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Complete a parenting class. 
Provide DNA sample. 
Comply and follow any CHIPS orders.
Contact with H.S.S. d.o.b. 10-19-02 as allowed by the CHIPS orders.   
Participate in any counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: letter from DOC dated 12/01/16 in re:  request for clarification of DNA Surcharge with response letter from Judge Eagon dated 12/06/16

ADDRESS INFO for Lashell C Schmude
Current: 5955 Birch Drive #22, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2016)
Prior: 5955 Birch Dr 22, Plover, WI 54467
Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

9:29 a.m. Defendant Lashell C Schmude in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed Count 1 is Amended and Counts 2, 3, & 4 are added.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Deferred Judgment on Count 1. W/H Sentence 24 mo probation w/conditions.  
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest to all four counts.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of all 4 counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court asks clarification and is not willing to approve a Deferred Judgment on Count 1.
Atty Renc requests withdrawal of pleas if not approving a Deferred Judgment on Count 1.
ADA Constable recommends to Dismiss outright.
Atty Renc concurs with Dismiss of Count 1.
BTC: Count 1 is Dismissed and Finds Guilty and enters Judgment of Conviction this date for Count 2, 3, & 4.
Atty Renc now concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION****
Count 2:  I  /  S  Sentence: 6 mo jail with huber, concurrent to each, only cts 2 & 3 to be on electronic monitor if eligible - 2 days credit - stayed
 24 mo   Probation
Conditions:
Complete a parenting class. 
Provide DNA sample. 
Comply and follow any CHIPS orders.
Contact with H.S.S. d.o.b. 10-19-02 as allowed by the CHIPS orders.   
Participate in any counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.

Count 3:  I  /  S  Sentence: 6 mo jail with huber, concurrent to each, only cts 2 & 3 to be on electronic monitor if eligible - 2 days credit - stayed
 24 mo   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1. 
Pay costs.

Count 4: I  /  S  Sentence: 90 days jail with huber, concurrent to each, 2 days credit - stayed
 24 mo   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1. 
Pay costs.

Telephone contact with HSS and the father as long as they are both in agreement with this change.
All other bond conditions remain the same

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:26 p.m.  Atty Renc would like to address the bond.
Atty Renc makes statements as to why she would like the bond conditions changed and states this on the record.
Atty Constable states she has no objection to the requested change in bond.

Defendant Lashell C Schmude in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:18 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Atty Constable is ready to proceed to Preliminary Hearing.
Deputy Mark Smallwood is sworn in.
3:19 p.m.  Direct examination by Atty Constable.
Witness describes the defendant; Court indicates that the witness has described the defendant.
3:22 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Renc.
State has no further witnesses.
Defense has no further witnesses.
3:23 p.m.  Witness is excused.

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lashell C Schmude in court with attorney Acalia Halverson appearing on behalf of Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: Bond continued. 

Atty Halverson makes bond arguments.  Asks for the defendant to have telephone or supervised contact with her daughter. 
Court questions Atty Halverson. 
Atty Cousins makes additional statements.   Asks the court to continue the bond until a formal motion can be filed. 

BY THE COURT:  Request is denied.  If Atty Halverson can get a letter from the case worker, the court will review.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$2,000 sig bond: No contact with H.S.S., unless there is a CHIPS petition that would allow.

1:36 p.m.
D.O.B: 05-16-1984
  ADA  Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable  states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Physical Abuse of a Child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant requests a signature bond.
State requests a $2,000 sig bond: with conditions as stated.
BTC:  $2,000 sig bond: No contact with H.S.S., unless there is a CHIPS petition that would allow.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   05-04-15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
